intro: Crantzia semicordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved crantzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white in color. Crantzia semicordata is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
